Chapter 8 Analytical notes 8.1 Household Composition and Poverty Certain types of household are more susceptible to poverty Figure 8.1: Household Type and Probability Among differnt household types, couple with children and single parent households are more susceptible to poverty. According to multinomial logit analysis, controlling for demographic conditions including age, education level, and household size, probability of being in lowerst quintile level is higher among parents and single parent household in most of the countries in the region. Households classified as couple with children also include grand parents and grand children and the share of female singe parents is bigger than male single parents. The finding shows that households with old or female caregivers may need more social protection to support their children as well as their own welfare. 8.2 Aceess to Goods Cell phones are more common than access to electricity Figure 8.2: Access to Cell Phone and Electricity There has been a global phenomenon that more people have access to mobile phones.
